Trial_Design.evidence: patients randomized to repair (n = 126) or replacement (n = 125)

Intervention.evidence: patients randomized to repair (n = 126) or replacement (n = 125)

Objective.evidence: We examined whether baseline echocardiographic and clinical characteristics could identify those who will develop moderate/severe recurrent mitral regurgitation or die.

Method_Outcome.evidence: no difference in the primary end point of left ventricular end-systolic volume index at 1 year postsurgery

Number_Randomised.evidence: patients randomized to repair (n = 126) or replacement (n = 125)

Number_Analysed.evidence: Our analysis includes 116 patients who were randomized to and received mitral valve repair.

Result_Outcome.evidence: patients undergoing repair experienced significantly more recurrent mitral regurgitation than patients undergoing replacement (32.6% vs 2.3%)
